comments.message:
Dear Mcdonalds,

As I opened my Facebook this morning, I thought that Christmas have came early. Truffle fries?! I couldn't believe my eyes, assuming that it was a well photoshopped joke. But no, it was a dream come true. 

And so I ran to the nearest Macdonalds at lunch and was pleasantly welcomed with a whiff of truffle fragrance. I couldn't help with my excitement, eagerly waiting in line and sending snapchats of the magical truffle packets to my friends. 

With my hands shaking with anticipation, I picked up one of the well shaken fries and devoured it. Immediately tears welled up in my eyes, as it brought back memories from 2 years ago - the day of my breakup. The ultimate betrayal.

ALL IT TASTED LIKE WAS ONIONS AND GARLIC! 

So, it was with a heavy heart that I decided to share my experience with everyone here. With expectations, come disappointments. 

A very disappointed truffle fries fan,
Zyane :'(
Truffle fries was an ultimate disappointment. Tried a few and left the whole bag untouched.
The smell can already tell you what to expect from the taste of truffle 😧 horrible experience
Funny expecting truffle fries from mac to taste like the truffle fries from cafes.. price comparison explains it all..
Your truffle flavoured fries taste like the tears of disappointed children being told Santa isn't real.
The truffle fries is a disappointment. Seaweed fries still taste better
Disappointed... I order mcdelivery, I had the new burger but they didn't deliver the truffle shaker bag n the seasoning.. Truffle fries is not available for mcdelivery?

Tbh... I thought the truffle fries are pretty good for what it is. I don't expect to pay 2 dollars for Joel Robuchon, ya know? I find that it's a nice touch to the holiday season for introducing truffle to the menu. 

P.S. For those connoisseurs out there, here's Joel Robuchon's number 6577 7888 for you to make your reservation. lol

The truffle fries seasoning tasted damn vile. For those of you whom patronise cafes for truffle fries, ya'll know what it actually tasted like but this McDonald's truffle seasoning is just disgusting. 👎

The truffle fries smells really bad. And tastes like salt onion and garlic. No truffle experience here at all. Seaweed beats it by a looooong shot. 

Club burger is 'meh'. That's what you get by using 'meh' bacon. Nothing beats the real thing (I completely understand why you can't use the real thing). If you know that the substitute isn't good enough , then don't do it at all. Bring back samurai burger. 

Overall, this is an uninspired mediocre doesn't-feel-like-Christmas-at-all meal. 

Still love your Double Mcspicy!
Disappointment with truffle fries... Bring back seaweed fries. thanks.

Disappointed in this burger. See the tiny amount of sauce?! I think all your new burgers are so dry! And the truffle fries, worse shaker fries i ever tasted. Don't waste your money people.. Nor Aishah

Review of the new Christmas meal. The beef burger is only one minced meat patty. (Nicely done but overpriced considering its just a variant of quarter pounder without fats.). The bun is relatively hard and dry. Not as dry as sesame bun but its not as tasty as fillet bun. The velvet flurry is just strawberry ice cream. The truffle fries is just    plain truffle salt. The fries needs to be served unsalted else the truffle salt will make it too salty. You can smell the truffle salt once you pur in the bag. And that's all. There is no truffle taste in the bag. That's my first and last try of the meal. I'd rather get double quarter pounder meal.
Truffle fries... taste horrible... so... this is what christmas taste like...
The clubhouse burger very dissatisfied cheese burger taste better than this

The issue with the McDonald's truffle shaker packet is the same as "truffle oil", a mono-dimensional scent of benzene with a lack of actual truffle bouquet, as engineered by food scientists.

Actual truffle is more subtle and delicate...go to Isetan Supermarket @ Westgate if you want real truffle pieces in olive oil. But beware, the price by weight is steep, and even then it isn't the highest grade truffle you can get!

Imagine the HDB rubbish chute and mushrooms growing at the bottom of the moist, disgusting rubbish bin. Then someone came along, picked some of these mushrooms, ground it into powder and sprinkled it onto your fries and telling you its truffles.
So disappointed w the staff attitude!! Ordered truffle fries n request for no salt! Then staff so rude!!! Argue back somemore! Super bad service!
In my opinion ,the taste of bacon inside the burger was just like feeling of biting rubber+iron its dam awful.The fries also such a rubbish. gg.com

comments.message: 21Nov15 Earlier on today went to McDonald Admiralty place ard 12 noon to buy mocha frappe for my Daughter upon ordering on the left hand side 1st counter have not mentioned yet how many I want to purchase tis counter staff Chinese lady give me a stern look n told me tat a customer can purchase only 1 frappe only wen I ask her Wat do u mean n trying to say? She suddenly remain quiet n leave me puzzle? As me n husb ever bought tis frappe promo at Causeway Point outlet n we bought ard 2.. Upon collection I check with another McDonald staff n she told me there's no limit n while stock last... So what's the 1st counter staff  n her motive?! I tot all McDonald outlet should be standardised.. After that I went to causeway pt outlet n approach tis relation manager a Malay guy check with him n he told me tat this promo ve no limits to purchase n while stock last... Told him with regards to the incident n he apologised on behalf of McDonald n the staff. Lastly what's the point of having promo if u can purchase only 1? I can understand if there's stated limits or terms n conditions upon purchase to be fair to the customer not by just verbally frm the counter staff. Her reaction n gesture is really rude n she's not being tactful as she's working in the front line. Spoil my today lastly thanks to the relation manager Mr Ryan Fadhli  Causeway Point who attend to my feedback n queries n clear my doubt.
